replies.msg:
有次比外國傳媒採訪唔系好識答
利申 我唔算系前線 只系一個好愛香港嘅學生妹
提供小小比記者問過嘅題目同回應希望幫到各位巴打：

5-10 MINUTES Q&A for HongKongers, who may be interviewed by the foreign media:
( Q = questions that media may ask ; A = suggested answer, feel free to reply other opinions~ )

Q: Hi, may I ask you some questions about the protests in Hong Kong? What’s your name?
A: Sure, you can call me ________. ( eg. Miss Lau / Mr Lau / Kiki / … DON’T PROVIDE YOUR WHOLE NAME! )

Q: What is your view of Hong Kong anti-extradition bill protests? Do you agree the protesters are violence, or the police?
A: This is a campaign which is seen as the most serious political crisis since the return of Hong Kong in 1997. I definitely stand with the protesters. In my opinion, the excessive use of force by the police was not appropriated. ( PROVIDE THE TRUE NEWS THAT YOU KNOW!! ) They hit and caught many people, such as the protesters, the elderly and the press, without any reason while they were dispersing the people … A teenager, who stand on the opposite road, shouted “ Where is your conscience? “ to the police and later got arrested and hit by 5 to 7 police … The police shoot the tear gas on the roof on the building and made the residents feel ill…Obviously, the police is in cahoots with the triads. They only arrested 6 in connection with Yuen Long violence…

Q: Is the core problem of this campaign on the act of the Government?
A: Government plays an significant role in this campaign. Carrie Lam and her team have the responsibility to solve this problem by listening to our 5 demands, faithfully. Carrie Lam proposed four actions and announced that she would withdraw the draft amendment to the Fugitive Offenders Ordinance, however, she did not respond to the other four claims. Until September 2, the police arrested 1,117 people. “If we accept the government's conditions, our friends who have sacrificed their lives will never forgive us.”

.
.
.


Q: Anything else? Any word for the Hong Kong people?
A: I believe we can be succeed. “5 Demands, not one less.” / “Wish the glory belong to Hong Kong.” Hope the people will understand our belief, and support us to achieve our goals. Thank you so much for asking me questions.
